Wolf, Christa
@graph.title: Christa Wolf : a companion
abstract: "This broad-ranging, English-language anthology introduces the renowned public intellectual Christa Wolf in her times and for today. Scholars from across the globe explore the East German author's variously received oeuvre and her influence in world literature. From new perspectives, they highlight topics such as subjective authenticity, agency, gender, environmentalism, geopolitics, war, and memory, and Wolf's work on film"--

Introduction: Reading Christa Wolf in the twenty-first century / Curtis Swope -- Modernity and the city in Christa Wolf's Oeuvre of the 1960s / Regine Criser -- Narrative topographies in Christa Wolf's Oeuvre / Anna K. Kuhn -- The gendered reception of Christa Wolf / Deborah Janson -- Unearthing a post-humanist ecological socialism in Christa Wolf's "Selbstversuch", Kassandra and Störfall / Sabine von Mering -- Nature, power and literature: Rereading Christa Wolf's Störfall.
